thread.title: Prescott Valley's Panthers claim Quad-City volleyball title
thread.title_full: Prescott Valley's Panthers claim Quad-City volleyball title

title: Prescott Valley's Panthers claim Quad-City volleyball title
text: Prescott Valley's Panthers claim Quad-City volleyball title Marty Boles/Courtesy photo For the first time since the inception of the traveling Quad-City Championship Volleyball Tournament trophy in 2004, the Glassford Hill Middle School volleyball team took home the top prize in a 2-0 win over Liberty Traditional School on Oct. 2. Brian M. Bergner Jr. The Daily Courier PRESCOTT VALLEY - For the first time since the inception of the traveling Quad-City Championship Volleyball Tournament trophy in 2004, the Glassford Hill Middle School volleyball team took home the top prize in a 2-0 win over Liberty Traditional School on Oct. 2."Many thanks to the parents of the Glassford Hill players for their dedication and support to the team," Glassford Hill head coach Marty Boles said. "They were the 'Seventh Player' to help us through the tournament."It is also the first time in the 11-year history of the trophy that a Humboldt Unified School District middle school has won the tournament.The Panthers marched to the championship by beating the Mile High Red Team, 25-18, 25-9, in the morning of Oct. 2. They played the Mile High White Team immediately following that match and beat them, 25-11, 25-21.In the winner's bracket, the Panthers would face Liberty Traditional School, handing the Eagles their first loss of the tournament, 25-15, 25-15. After the Eagles won a match in the loser's bracket, they returned to play Glassford Hill for the title.In the championship match, the Eagles were outmatched by Glassford Hill as the Panthers claimed the title, 25-18, 25-7.
